title: Gran Tierra Energy Inc. (NYSE:GTE) Major Shareholder Buys $125,070.63 in Stock
text:
Gran Tierra Energy Inc. (NYSE:GTE) Major Shareholder Buys $125,070.63 in Stock Written by MarketBeat April 16, 2025 Share Link copied to clipboard. Remove Ads Gran Tierra Energy Inc. ( NYSE:GTE - Get Free Report ) major shareholder Equinox Partners Investment Ma purchased 33,531 shares of the firm's stock in a transaction on Thursday, April 10th. The shares were purchased at an average cost of $3.73 per share, for a total transaction of $125,070.63. Following the completion of the purchase, the insider now directly owns 1,937,651 shares in the company, valued at $7,227,438.23. The trade was a 1.76 % increase in their ownership of the stock. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which is available at the SEC website . Major shareholders that own more than 10% of a company's stock are required to disclose their sales and purchases with the SEC.
Get Gran Tierra Energy alerts: Sign Up Equinox Partners Investment Ma also recently made the following trade(s): On Monday, April 7th, Equinox Partners Investment Ma bought 146,460 shares of Gran Tierra Energy stock. The shares were purchased at an average price of $3.94 per share, for a total transaction of $577,052.40. On Friday, April 4th, Equinox Partners Investment Ma purchased 123,000 shares of Gran Tierra Energy stock. The stock was acquired at an average price of $4.11 per share, with a total value of $505,530.00. On Wednesday, April 2nd, Equinox Partners Investment Ma acquired 5,000 shares of Gran Tierra Energy stock. The stock was acquired at an average cost of $5.16 per share, with a total value of $25,800.00. Gran Tierra Energy Trading Up 4.3 %
Shares of GTE traded up $0.17 during mid-day trading on Monday, hitting $4.13. The company had a trading volume of 213,640 shares, compared to its average volume of 312,699. Gran Tierra Energy Inc. has a 1-year low of $3.34 and a 1-year high of $10.40. The business's 50-day simple moving average is $4.91 and its 200-day simple moving average is $6.02. The stock has a market cap of $148.22 million, a PE ratio of 2.89 and a beta of 0.89. The company has a quick ratio of 1.19, a current ratio of 1.31 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.71. title: Россиянка оглохла и перестала чувствовать половину тела во время отдыха в Китае: что с ней произошло
text:
Петербурженка во время отдыха в Китае полностью потеряла слух, а после назначенного местными врачами лечения у нее частично онемело тело. Об этом сообщил telegram-канал Shot.
«Россиянка полностью оглохла во время отдыха в Китае. А после лечения от местных медиков у нее еще и онемела половина тела», — передает telegram-канал.
Жительница Петербурга отправилась на отдых в китайский город Санью в начале июля. Первые дни поездки прошли без происшествий. Однако спустя время девушка проснулась с острой болью в ушах, которая мешала ей открыть рот и проглатывать пищу. Позднее к этим симптомам добавилась высокая температура, а на следующее утро россиянка полностью оглохла на оба уха.
Пострадавшая вместе с супругом обратилась за медпомощью в одну из местных больниц, где врачи назначили ей гормональные препараты. Несмотря на сомнения относительно связи лекарств с лечением ушей, девушка последовала рекомендациям. Уже через 30 минут после приема таблеток она перестала ощущать левую половину тела. Медики объяснили это побочным эффектом препарата. Однако позже выяснилось, что назначенная доза значительно превышала допустимую. Тогда россиянка обратилась за консультацией к врачам на родине. Специалисты в РФ предположили, что у пациентки развился бактериальный отит, полученный, вероятно, во время купания в воде.
В итоге, девушке прописали курс антибиотиков, ей с большим трудом удалось получить рецепт на лекарства и купить их в Санье. Несмотря на начатое лечение, слух у петербурженки пока не восстановился.

author: VNExplorer
title: Novogratz's Galaxy Ventures Fund Tops Fundraising Goal - VNExplorer
text: (Bloomberg) -- Billionaire Michael Novogratz’s Galaxy Ventures Fund I LP has surpassed its goal of raising $150 million to build a portfolio of about 30 investments, a person familiar with the matter said.The fund, which invests in early-stage startups and has had a strong focus on payments and stablecoins, now expects to close at the end of June with $175 million to $180 million raised, according to the person, who asked for anonymity because the amount hasn’t been made public. A spokesperson for New York-based Galaxy declined to comment.The fund is closing at a time when venture funding is still hard to come by in the crypto industry. Despite a friendlier environment for digital assets in the US and globally, venture capital activity has largely remained at a standstill. Crypto VC investments in the US decreased 22% to about $1.3 billion in the first three months of the year, according to data compiled by Pitchbook.Key Speakers At The iConnections Global Alts 2024 EventThe digital-asset firm’s Galaxy Ventures has long invested between $30 million and $50 million a year of Galaxy’s own money into various crypto startups. Galaxy then moved the group into its asset management division, and started Galaxy Ventures Fund, which is open to outside investors.The new fund’s limited partners are mostly family offices and high-net-worth individuals, the person said. Galaxy has also made investments into the fund as well.Galaxy recently received permission for a direct listing on the Nasdaq stock exchange, with trading expected to happen after a special shareholder meeting in May.Most Read from Bloomberg©2025 Bloomberg L.P.

author: Notizie, Sport, eventi live
title: Il Lugano piega il Ginevra e manda un primo segnale
text:
Il Lugano ha iniziato nel miglior modo possibile il tour de force di quattro partite in sei giorni. Obbligati a fare punti per risalire la china e alimentare le speranze del ridimensionato obiettivo dei play-in, i bianconeri non hanno fallito l’appuntamento della Cornèr Arena con il Ginevra, sceso in Ticino - va sottolineato - con soli tre stranieri e diverse assenze. Il 5-2 finale è comunque fedele testimone di una partita che i padroni di casa hanno approcciato con l’atteggiamento di chi ci crede per davvero e che ha evidenziato, più che la solidità difensiva, un ritrovato powerplay. Un altro esercizio fondamentale su cui costruire il finale di stagione.
Gettato per la prima volta nella mischia Sekac, il cui rientro dalla squalifica ha portato al cambio tra Schlegel-Huska tra i pali, Krupp ha potuto assistere ad un inizio di partita sicuramente positivo dei suoi, subito dinamici e presenti sul fronte offensivo anche se mai davvero pericolosi. Gli ospiti si sono invece fatti vedere per la prima volta con Loosli, scappato a tu per tu con Schlegel ma fermato al momento del tiro, prima di trovare il gol del vantaggio all’11’27” con Praplan, che ha approfittato del lavoro di Richard dopo un ingaggio malamente gestito da Zohorna in box play. Il vantaggio ha scosso i ginevrini, vicini addirittura al raddoppio con Karrer (traversa), che sarebbe però stato esagerato considerate le grandi opportunità mancate da Marco Müller e Fazzini sul finale di primo periodo.
Mal ripagato, l’HCL ha insistito in avvio di secondo, andando vicino al pareggio con Patry e Thürkauf. Vissuta un ventina di secondi surreale a metà confronto, con gli arbitri che si sono accorti colpevolmente in ritardo dei sei uomini sul ghiaccio del Servette, i bianconeri non hanno sfruttato il conseguente (primo) powerplay, venendo finalmente premiati tre volte tra il 34’06” e il 39’12” con Alatalo (powerplay), Patry (ripartenza) e Thürkauf (powerplay). I due ferri colpiti da Hartikainen e Praplan hanno forse avuto il pregio di mettere in guardia i bianconeri in un terzo tempo che li ha visti replicare al 2-3 di Berni (5 contro 4 al 45’51”) con l’immediato 4-2 di Jesper Peltonen (47’04”). Un gol, questo, che ha dunque sottolineato i progressi anche sul piano caratteriale, anticipando quello che ha definito il punteggio di Zohorna al 56’40”.
NL, l’intervista a Lorenzo Canonica (23.01.2025)

author: 小浪财讯
title: MSCI中国A50ETF（560050）跌0.73%，半日成交额2671.03万元|MSCI_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，MSCI中国A50ETF（560050）跌0.73%，报0.813元，成交额2671.03万元。MSCI中国A50ETF（560050）重仓股方面， 宁德时代 截止午盘跌1.13%， 贵州茅台 涨0.00%， 紫金矿业 跌1.44%， 比亚迪 跌1.40%， 招商银行 跌0.70%， 海光信息 跌0.68%， 万华化学 跌1.07%， 长江电力 跌0.33%， 立讯精密 跌0.58%， 恒瑞医药 跌0.66%。
MSCI中国A50ETF（560050）业绩比较基准为MSCI中国A50互联互通人民币指数收益率，管理人为汇添富基金管理股份有限公司，基金经理为乐无穹、吴振翔，成立（2021-10-29）以来回报为-18.08%，近一个月回报为-1.15%。

author: @shanghaiist
title: Research Team Creates Spring-Inspired Soft Robot for Targeted Medical Treatments
text: - A Chinese-German team developed a biocompatible, soft tiny robot with spring-like capabilities, designed for applications in precision medicine, such as microsurgery and targeted drug delivery, detailed in Nature Nanotechnology. - The micro-robot, created by researchers from SIAT, the Leibniz Institute, and Chemnitz University of Technology, features a highly sensitive magnetic spring system that can deform with micron-scale precision. - Boasting a sensitivity that can detect forces as small as one-thousandth the gravity of a single cell, the versatile robot can be shaped for various uses, including as a sperm motility sensor and a tweezer for cell manipulation. “` In a joint effort between Chinese and German researchers, a novel soft robotic device resembling a spring has been created to perform sensitive tasks, including handling individual cells. The study, detailing the creation of this micro-scale robot, has been featured in the journal Nature Nanotechnology. Innovative Micro-Robot Design - Collaboration between the Shenzhen Institutes of Advanced Technology, Leibniz Institute for Solid State and Materials Research Dresden, and Chemnitz University of Technology. - Creation of a magnetic spring system capable of micro-deformations through tiny strains. - Biocompatibility allows for applications in precise medical procedures. Biological Inspiration and Sensitivity - Inspired by biological organisms that utilize spring mechanisms for various functions. - The robotic system’s sensitivity is so acute; it can detect forces as light as one-thousandth of a single cell’s gravity. Potential Medical Applications - Can be shaped to suit various biomedical tasks. - Potential uses include microsurgery tools, targeted drug delivery systems, and cell manipulation tweezers. - Could serve as a sensor to analyze sperm motility. Xu Haifeng of the SIAT, who is the first and corresponding author of the study, highlighted the remarkable sensitivity of the nanoscale spring-like robot, which opens up new avenues for precision medicine and innovative medical robotics.
